Sentencas: Properties of silver at elevated temperatures limit its use as a porous electrode or current collector in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) configurations.
Titulo: Silver Based Perovskite Nanocomposites as Combined Cathode and Current Collector Layers for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Its relatively low melting temperature (962 degrees C) leads to accelerated densification of silver at operating temperatures of intermediate temperature SOFCs (550 degrees C-800 degrees C).
Titulo: Silver Based Perovskite Nanocomposites as Combined Cathode and Current Collector Layers for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In previous studies, powder based silver composites demonstrated stable microstructures with desirable porosity and electrical conductivity during long-term testing.
Titulo: Silver Based Perovskite Nanocomposites as Combined Cathode and Current Collector Layers for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Although the characterized features of the silver based composites allowed their use as efficient and stable cathode current collectors, they demonstrated limited electrochemical performance as a cathode layer.
Titulo: Silver Based Perovskite Nanocomposites as Combined Cathode and Current Collector Layers for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this study, nanostructured coatings of various perovskite based cathode materials (lanthanum-strontium manganite (LSM), lanthanum-strontium ferrite (LSF), lanthanum-strontium cobalt-ferrite (LSCF)) were deposited into porous silver composites by infiltration of polymeric precursors to enhance their electrode efficiencies.
Titulo: Silver Based Perovskite Nanocomposites as Combined Cathode and Current Collector Layers for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: As a result, novel metal-matrix perovskite nanocomposites were obtained.
Titulo: Silver Based Perovskite Nanocomposites as Combined Cathode and Current Collector Layers for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The properties of the Ag based nanocomposites allowed their use as a combined cathode and current collector layer with significantly improved electrochemical performance and long term stability at 800 degrees C in air.
Titulo: Silver Based Perovskite Nanocomposites as Combined Cathode and Current Collector Layers for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
